item.title: [Python] Exceptions: An introductions
item.description: Refer to https://realpython.com/python-exceptions/ Raising an Exception Example x = 10 if x > 5: raise Exception('x should not exceed 5.') The AssertionError Exception refer to https://dbader.org/blog/python-assert-tutorial Python’s assertions are a powerful debugging tool that’s frequently underused by Python developers. What is the assert If the condition is True, it does nothing and your program just continues to execute. But if the assert condition evaluates to False, it raises an AssertionError exception with an optional error message.
